| HistoryText             = As a consequence of [[Onslaught (Psychic Entity) (Earth-616)|Onslaught's]] apparent massacre of several heroes, New York suffered a power vacuum after the [[Fantastic Four (Earth-616)|Fantastic Four]] and [[Avengers (Earth-616)|Avengers]] were presumed killed. Following up on the status of the Oracle corporation that [[Namor McKenzie (Earth-616)|Namor]], [[Jim Hammond (Earth-616)|Jim Hammond]] (the Golden Age Human Torch) and [[Daniel Thomas Rand-K'ai (Earth-616)|Danny Rand]] decided to set up a new Heroes For Hire organization. Iron Fist recruited [[Luke Cage (Earth-616)|Luke Cage]] for this. The core team consisted of Fist, Cage, and an assortment of others: [[Dane Whitman (Earth-616)|Black Knight (Dane Whitman)]], a new [[White Tiger (Evolved Tiger) (Earth-616)|White Tiger]], and [[Scott Lang (Earth-616)|Ant-Man (Scott Lang)]]. Together they battled the [[U-Foes (Earth-616)|U-Foes]] and the [[Eshu (Earth-616)|Master of the World]].{{r|Heroes for Hire #1}}	

Namor sold [[Oracle Inc.]] to [[Stark-Fujikawa]] who wanted to fire Cage and Lang for being ex-cons and then also have complete control of what missions they take, the members of Heroes for Hire decided to quit instead.{{r|Heroes for Hire #19}}
